greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = binomial(2n-1, n-1) mod n.
comment: For p prime, a(p)=1. For n in A058008, a(n)=0.
For n the square of a prime p>=3 or the cube of a prime p>=5, a(n)=1. - _Franz Vrabec_, Mar 26 2008
For n in A228562, a(n)=1. - _Felix Fröhlich_, Oct 17 2015
link: Felix Fröhlich, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
R. J. McIntosh, On the converse of Wolstenholme's theorem, Acta Arithmetica 71 (4): 381-389, (1995).
maple: A099905:=n->binomial(2*n-1,n-1) mod n: seq(A099905(n), n=1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 17 2015
program: (PARI) a(n) = lift(Mod(binomial(2*n-1, n-1), n)) \\ _Felix Fröhlich_, Oct 17 2015
(MAGMA) [Binomial(2*n-1,n-1) mod n : n in [1..100]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 17 2015
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Oct 29 2004
